entries.content: When a prospect says 'I have no interest' or 'I'm not interested,' respond in the form of a question.
When you say you're not interested, did you mean to say never ever under any circumstances would you consider exploring what we do?
entries.notes: Example phrase to push disinterest to the extreme.

entries.content: Push the prospect's statement of disinterest to the extreme (e.g., 'never ever under any circumstances') to diagnose if it's absolute or conditional.
By asking a clarifying question about their disinterest, you can potentially open the door to further conversation if their 'no' isn't absolute.
Do not argue with the prospect's objection; instead, seek to understand or clarify it using questions.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
